com.projecttango.unibw.graphmapper.floorplan

Class GraphmapperRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.rajawali3d.renderer.RajawaliRenderer
      • com.projecttango.unibw.graphmapper.floorplan.GraphmapperRenderer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.rajawali3d.surface.IRajawaliSurfaceRenderer

    public class GraphmapperRenderer
extends org.rajawali3d.renderer.RajawaliRenderer

    Very simple augmented reality visialization which displays cubes fixed in place for every WallMeasurement. Each time the user clicks on the screen, a cube with the specifiy type is placed flush with the surface detected using the point cloud data at the position clicked.

    The entrypoint and marker type can be placed on the wall or on the ground or on the wall (option).

    This class is from the Java Floorlan example (https://github.com/googlesamples/tango-examples-java) and was edited by the author. Added changes of Google's Okul update from June 9th (13.06.2016).

    Version:
    3.0
    Author:
    Konstantin Klinger

      • updateRenderCameraPose

        public void updateRenderCameraPose(TangoPoseData cameraPose)
        Update the scene camera based on the provided pose in Tango start of service frame. The device pose should match the pose of the device at the time of the last rendered RGB frame, which can be retrieved with this.getTimestamp(); NOTE: This must be called from the OpenGL render thread - it is not thread safe.
        Parameters:
        cameraPose - (position of the camera)

      • getTextureId

        public int getTextureId()
        It returns the ID currently assigned to the texture where the Tango color camera contents should be rendered. NOTE: This must be called from the OpenGL render thread - it is not thread safe.
        Returns:
        ID of the Texture
